intro: Malacothamnus abbottii, commonly known as Abbott's needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, needle-like leaves that help reduce water loss.
